history.content: If you are planning to get a Master's, then apply for a PhD, I doubt that one undergrad grad will matter much. It's you decision to make, but based on the fact that you said you couldn't get a flat A, I would guess that you're not doing that poorly (by which I mean at risk of failing). One weaker grade on your transcript is not a huge deal, I would just take the letter. If you do not, some grad schools might look at the P and count it as a C.

children.subject: I got -1 stddev on the first midterm, but can probably study harder to make sure I do better on the second midterm.
I might actually get a B+ in the course if I'm not careful. Would this be bad in the future if I also have honors thesis work and a grad class work?
I'm kind of in the same situation lol!! I just made my post here and came across yours. https://piazza.com/class/hyq0br1u3kx7dg?cid=16836

history.content: I'm a senior at berkeley who will continue with master's next year, but am thinking after master's I may want to continue onto pursuing PhD program. how badly would it look to PNP 182?  (did pretty poorly on one midterm to say I can't get a flat A anymore in the course)
